body.p: To your excelency Govenor of Ky -- We the undersigned petition your excelency to remit a find against Harison Trisler & Henry Trisler for rioting at the May election^assessed by ^a Jury before^ Geo. T. Nave Esq a Justice of the Peace for Jessamine Co.^ -- The Jury assessed their find at $17 -- each -- Making $34 -- in all which we the petitioners think unreasonable under the circumstances and unjust -- and ask you to do them the kindness to remit the same as they are both poor ^hard working industrious young men -- the latter with a family -- ^ and not able to pay it -- these hard times --

W. B Smith --

The undersigned the Justice of the Peace in & for the County of Jessamine who presided at the trial for the assessement of the fine by a Jury named in the within Petition against Henry & Harrison Trisler for $17.00 each for rioting states that he regard the amount of the fines exorbitant= & from subsequent evidences & Circumstances developed bearing on the case, he thinks said fines should be remitted in Justice of ^to^ the parties -- & he would therefore advise and recommend it. Aug 13. 1861. --
George T. Nave J. P. J. C.

I am personally acquainted with the subcribers or Petitioners signed to the within Petition -- & I know they are all resident citizens of the Neighborhood in which the Rioting occurred & the fines were assessed -- & the Petitioners are entitled to full faith and credit -- Augt 13. 1861. --

M. T. Lowry clk
Jessamine County Court

Jessamine J. P.
$17. each } breach
H. & H. Trisler
Remission Issd Sept 4. 1861
